title: Nature's mood rings: How chameleons really change color

multiple-choice.question: What is the main misconception about chameleons' ability to change color?

options.label: A
options.text: They change color to match their environment.

options.label: B
options.text: They change color to communicate with other animals.

options.label: C
options.text: They change color to regulate their body temperature.

options.label: D
options.text: They change color to protect themselves from predators.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the iridophores in a chameleon's skin?

options.label: B
options.text: To reflect light and create color.

options.label: C
options.text: To absorb water and regulate hydration.

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the salt crystals in a chameleon's skin?

options.label: A
options.text: They are arranged in a two-dimensional lattice.

options.label: B
options.text: They are arranged in a three-dimensional lattice.

options.label: C
options.text: They are made up of melanin.

options.label: D
options.text: They are made up of keratin.

multiple-choice.question: How do the iridophores in a chameleon's skin create color?

options.label: A
options.text: By absorbing light and reflecting it back.

options.label: B
options.text: By shattering light into different wavelengths.

options.label: C
options.text: By producing pigments and spreading them across the skin.

options.label: D
options.text: By reflecting light off the surface of the skin.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the crystals reflecting a different wavelength of light in a chameleon's skin?

options.label: A
options.text: A change in the texture of the skin.

options.label: B
options.text: A change in the temperature of the skin.

options.label: D
options.text: A change in the shape of the skin.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the electrical engineers at UC Berkeley trying to achieve?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a material that can change shape like a chameleon's skin.

options.label: B
options.text: To mimic a chameleon's structural color control with synthetic materials.

options.label: C
options.text: To study the behavior of chameleons in their natural habitat.

options.label: D
options.text: To develop a new type of camouflage technology.

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the synthetic chameleon skin created by the electrical engineers?

options.label: A
options.text: It has multiple layers of nano-scale arrays.

options.label: B
options.text: It has only one layer of nano-scale arrays.

options.label: C
options.text: It is made up of melanin.

options.label: D
options.text: It is made up of keratin.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of the chameleon's skin over the synthetic material?

options.label: C
options.text: It has multiple layers of nano-scale arrays.

options.label: D
options.text: It produces colors that aren't even visible to human eyes.

multiple-choice.question: What does the author like about chameleons?

options.label: B
options.text: They are well-known for their camouflage abilities.

options.label: C
options.text: They show us how wrong we can be about science.

options.label: D
options.text: They are the most colorful animals in the animal kingdom.

multiple-choice.question: What is the visual language made of, according to the author?

options.label: A
options.text: A series of clicks and whistles.

options.label: B
options.text: A series of low rumbles and moans.

title: Why does February only have 28 days?

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason the Romans needed a calendar to organize their festivals, feasts, and celebrations?

options.label: A
options.text: The increasing number of solar equinoxes and solstices.

options.label: C
options.text: The need to keep track of festivals, feasts, military ceremonies, and religious celebrations.

multiple-choice.question: What type of calendar did the ancient Romans initially use to organize their festivals and celebrations?
What was the problem with the initial Roman calendar that had 10 months of either 30 or 31 days?

options.label: D
options.text: It had too many days that didn't fit into the four seasons.

multiple-choice.question: Which king of Rome introduced a new calendar that had 12 months and 355 days?
Why did Numa Pompilius remove a day from all the even-numbered months?

options.label: B
options.text: Because it would have been an odd number.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it would have been an even number.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it would have been too long.

multiple-choice.question: What was the purpose of the 27-day leap month added after February 23rd or 24th every other year?

options.label: A
options.text: To add extra days to the calendar.

options.label: B
options.text: To keep the seasons in order.

options.label: C
options.text: To average out the days in the calendar.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the calendar more confusing.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Julius Caesar introduce a solar calendar in 46 BC?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the lunar calendar was too complicated.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the solar calendar was more accurate.

options.label: C
options.text: Because he had spent time in Egypt and saw the benefits of a 365-day calendar.

options.label: D
options.text: Because he wanted to rename the months.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main difference between the Roman calendar and the Egyptian calendar?

options.label: A
options.text: The number of days in the year.

options.label: C
options.text: The number of months in the year.

options.label: D
options.text: The number of days in the month.

multiple-choice.question: Why did the Roman calendar need to be adjusted in 1500 years?

options.label: B
options.text: Because the calendar had become too long.

options.label: C
options.text: Because Pope Gregory made changes to the calendar.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the calendar had become too short.

multiple-choice.question: What was the ultimate result of Julius Caesar's introduction of the solar calendar?

options.label: C
options.text: The calendar was renamed after Julius Caesar and Augustus Caesar.

title: How did the deepest part of the ocean get so polluted?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B
